itemListElement.name: Vegan Chocolate Pumpkin Pie Recipe with Almond Crust

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Pumpkin Pie
@graph.description: This rich vegan chocolate pumpkin pie is perfect for youâ€™re craving something a little different this holiday season. An easy almond flour crust filled with a silky-smooth filling packed with the cozy flavors of chocolate, pumpkin and pumpkin spice. Free of dairy, egg, corn, soy, and gluten.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup coconut milk  (or other non-dairy milk)
1.5 Tbsp starch (like cornstarch or arrowroot starch)
1.5 cups pumpkin puree  (1 15 oz can, or use sweet potato puree)
1/4 cup coconut sugar or ground raw sugar (use less if using semi sweet chocolate instead of dark chocolate)
1 tsp pumpkin pie spice (or 3/4 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp ginger, generous pinch of cloves and nutmeg)
3 oz  70% dark chocolate (( 3 oz or about 2/3 cup), chopped )
1 x prepared and pre-baked Almond Crust  (or any other crust: see no-bake crust options on the blog)

recipeInstructions.text: In a saucepan over medium heat, add milk and starch and mix well. Add pumpkin puree, sugar, and spices and mix well. Bring the filling to a boil and let cook for about 5 minutes, stirring. The filling will thicken during that time.
recipeInstructions.name: In a saucepan over medium heat, add milk and starch and mix well. Add pumpkin puree, sugar, and spices and mix well. Bring the filling to a boil and let cook for about 5 minutes, stirring. The filling will thicken during that time.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the pot off the heat. Add the chopped dark and semi-sweet chocolate and let sit for 2 minutes. Then mix well with a spatula or whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the pot off the heat. Add the chopped dark and semi-sweet chocolate and let sit for 2 minutes. Then mix well with a spatula or whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the vanilla extract and mix in. Taste the filling and adjust the level of sweetness if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the vanilla extract and mix in. Taste the filling and adjust the level of sweetness if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the filling into a pre-baked crust like my Almond flour pie crust or any other pie/tart crust on the blog. Even the filling out using a spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the filling into a pre-baked crust like my Almond flour pie crust or any other pie/tart crust on the blog. Even the filling out using a spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Chill the pie 2 to 3 hours and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Chill the pie 2 to 3 hours and serve.

recipeInstructions.text: For clean slices, put the pie in the freezer for half an hour to an hour, then slice. Serve as is or with whipped coconut cream or a drizzle of salted caramel.
recipeInstructions.name: For clean slices, put the pie in the freezer for half an hour to an hour, then slice. Serve as is or with whipped coconut cream or a drizzle of salted caramel.

@graph.keywords: chocolate pumpkin pie recipe, pumpkin pie with chocolate, vegan pumpkin pie
